meanings.definition: The emission of visible light by a hot object.
meanings.sent1: The campfire's incandescence lit up the dark night.
meanings.sent2: The incandescence of the light bulb brightened the room.
meanings.sent3: The incandescence of the fireflies made the garden look magical.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an incandescence that warmed everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The incandescence of the fireworks painted the sky with colors.

meanings.definition: The state of being white or glowing with heat.
meanings.sent1: The incandescence of the iron indicated it was ready for use.
meanings.sent2: The incandescence of the stove burner warned of its high temperature.
meanings.sent3: The incandescence of the toaster made the bread toast quickly.
meanings.sent4: The incandescence of the sun on the sand made it too hot to walk on barefoot.
meanings.sent5: The incandescence of the metal turned it a bright red color.
